title: Lontor
author: Lontor
content: I planned to buy some altcoins now that we are in a bear market but someone I knew is telling me not to, that its possible more dumps will take place, my question is how will I know when it's the right time to buy coins?

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Instead of timing the market (which you will most likely fail) to buy altcoins, why not instead buy bitcoin to minimize the risk? That way you won't have to obsessively follow the market to find the best time to sell it like you have to do with shitcoins since they have short pump period which are then followed by the dump. And yeah, best time to buy bitcoin is always now.Also, if you think that bitcoin might go down more (and that could be the case), you can always use DCA method.

You can stack sats(the lowest unit of bitcoin) with whatever amount you are willing to put in bitcoin rather than going for altcoins.There might be more dumps or not can't be said but this time you will definitely get some bitcoin at sale so grab as much you can to secure your future without wasting it on altcoins.Rest it's your personal choice where to invest but don't go for some scam projects out there and also invest what you afford to loose.

comments.author: Marvelman
comments.body: Quote from: Lontor on May 11, 2022, 09:48:23 AMI planned to buy some altcoins now that we are in a bear market but someone I knew is telling me not to, that its possible more dumps will take place, my question is how will I know when it's the right time to buy coins? Just as no one else can know, neither can you. The best you can do is estimate based on market sentiment and a set of facts that give you some sense of the wisdom of crowds. Since you are inexperienced in trading, I suggest you stay away from altcoin cryptocurrencies. They are much more volatile than bitcoin. Remember, with assets such as bitcoin, your return is almost guaranteed. But with altcoins, your return is less certain.The safest way is to only invest a portion of your net worth, preferably as a small percentage of your income. The idea is to be patient and let the market make its choices for you. Do not try to time the market by going in and out. As you are learning, patience is the best virtue.

comments.author: 0verseer
comments.created_time: May 11, 2022, 06:26:47 PMLast edit: May 12, 2022, 03:59:50 AM by 0verseer
comments.body: Unless you got 'clairvoyance' to see the future or exclusive news from inside trading, no you just can't time it right. What we should do is wait till the market shows a good sign that we're out of the bear market. So we can invest in the market and expect a good margin of profit from price differences (buy low, sell high). Trying to catch the dips when there is no good sign on the market's recovery is the quickest way to become a long-time holder. You might eventually get out the entry price, back to where you've brought it. But your fund is wasted by sitting there frozen for a long time instead of cutting loss, which put you back to square one with less money than before. See the risk of timing wrong instead of waiting and being reactive?
